DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , multi-center study examine clinical impact Corus® CAD assay approximately 250 evaluable subject history obstructive coronary artery disease present chest pain anginal-equivalent symptom primary care physician ( PCP ) evaluation .
DOC.brief_title: Primary Care Providers Use Gene Expression Test Coronary Artery Disease Diagnosis
DOC.detailed_description: In symptomatic patient without prior cardiac testing , PCP initially decide subject 's pretest probability coronary artery disease ( CAD ) base subject 's risk factor quality chest pain ( typical atypical ) , anginal equivalent ( e.g. , jaw , arm pain , unexplained shortness breath ) consider result prior test , applicable . The initial questionnaire capture PCP 's initial clinical impression decision ( 'preliminary decision ' ) evaluate manage patient . A Corus® CAD assay perform PCP 's office . After PCP receive Corus® CAD result ( approximately 2-3 day later ) , PCP decide appropriate evaluation management patient ( 'final decision ' ) use Corus® CAD result conjunction his/her clinical impression and/or clinical data available . The primary aim study evaluate whether Corus® CAD test result associate change PCPs ' diagnostic evaluation management patient compare initial test treatment decision . Since take approximately two day physician receive result Corus® CAD , symptomatic subject unstable angina , suspicion myocardial infarction exclude study . A follow-up phone call detail questionnaire perform 30 + 15 day , time blood draw , assess triage decision , referral subspecialists ( cardiologist , gastroenterologist , pulmonologist ) , cardiac diagnostic test perform , cardiac procedure perform , result cardiac test procedure .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Stable chest pain , typical atypical angina anginal equivalent 2 . The patient sign appropriate Institutional Review Board approve Informed Consent Form . 1 . History myocardial infarction 2 . Current Myocardial infarction ( MI ) acute coronary syndrome . 3 . Current New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) class III IV congestive heart failure symptom . 4 . Any previous coronary revascularization . 5 . Any individual : Diabetes Suspected unstable angina Systemic infection Systemic inflammatory condition 6 . Any individual currently take : Steroids Immunosuppressive agent Chemotherapeutic agent 7 . Any Major Surgery within 2 month
